p: Parkia is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Fabaceae (subfamily, Mimosoideae) with pan-tropical distribution [ 1]. The word Parkia was named after the Scottish explorer Mungo Park, who drowned in the Niger River, Nigeria in January 1805 [ 2]. Thirty-one species from this genus were reported in 1995 [ 3]. Another four more species were discovered in 2009 [ 4]. Out of these species, 10 species found in Asia, four in Africa, and 20 in neotropics. Meanwhile, according to a plant list (2018), 80 scientific names are recorded from the genus Parkia containing 41 accepted names and 39 synonym species (The Plant List, 2018). These plants bear fruits called pods. Each pod contains up to 25â€“30 seeds. Many species from Parkia have been reported to be rich in carbohydrate [ 5, 6, 7], protein [ 8, 9, 10] and minerals [ 11, 12, 13, 14].
